intro: Atelophragma glabriusculum, commonly known as the smooth-stemmed fern, is a tropical plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Polypodiaceae and is characterized by its delicate, lance-shaped fronds. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments, such as rainforests or along stream banks. Its rhizomes are often used in traditional medicine for their purported healing properties. The leaves are usually leathery and have a smooth texture, contributing to its common name.
